DataElement.preferredName: Herpes Simplex Virus Quantitative Polymerase Chain Reaction Outcome 0 Decimal Place Copies per Milliliter Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 0 decimal place numeric laboratory value measured, assigned or computed related to herpes simplex virus quantitative polymerase chain reaction outcome.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Simplex Virus Real Time PCR Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A genus of enveloped, spherical or pleomorphic viruses with a capsid with T=16 icosahedral symmetry and surrounded by amorphous tegument, in the family Herpesviridae. The genome is composed of monopartite, linear double-stranded DNA. Simplexviruses are found in humans and mammals, may remain latent in neurons and cause skin blisters and mucosal ulcers in humans.:An application of PCR that measures the products generated during each cycle of the polymerase chain reaction process in order to determine the starting amount of template in the reaction._The result of an action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A genus of enveloped, spherical or pleomorphic viruses with a capsid with T=16 icosahedral symmetry and surrounded by amorphous tegument, in the family Herpesviridae. The genome is composed of monopartite, linear double-stranded DNA. Simplexviruses are found in humans and mammals, may remain latent in neurons and cause skin blisters and mucosal ulcers in humans.

Concepts.definition: A genus of enveloped, spherical or pleomorphic viruses with a capsid with T=16 icosahedral symmetry and surrounded by amorphous tegument, in the family Herpesviridae. The genome is composed of monopartite, linear double-stranded DNA. Simplexviruses are found in humans and mammals, may remain latent in neurons and cause skin blisters and mucosal ulcers in humans.

Property.preferredDefinition: An application of PCR that measures the products generated during each cycle of the polymerase chain reaction process in order to determine the starting amount of template in the reaction._The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: An application of PCR that measures the products generated during each cycle of the polymerase chain reaction process in order to determine the starting amount of template in the reaction.

DataElementConcept.administrativeNotes: 6/1/2023: reviewed and released per the metric report.wz

ValueDomain.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Integer::0 Decimal Place Copies per Milliliter Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::0_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A unit of concentration expressed as a number of copies per unit volume equal to one milliliter._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Integer::0 Decimal Place Copies per Milliliter Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::0:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:A unit of concentration expressed as a number of copies per unit volume equal to one milliliter.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
A unit of concentration expressed as a number of copies per unit volume equal to one milliliter.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 6/2/2023: reviewed and released per the metric report.wz
